channel.title: Max sprite id - items, how to raise?
channel.description:
Okay first of all the source is a RSCD v25.
I was playing around with "custom items" and their color, it worked until I got to 256 and over.
Example, from my ItemWieldableDef.xml [code] <entry> <int>1331</int> <ItemWieldableDef> <sprite>256</sprite> <type>8216</type> <wieldPos>4</wieldPos> <armourPoints>24</armourPoints> <weaponAimPoints>150</weaponAimPoints> <weaponPowerPoints>71</weaponPowerPoints> <magicPoints>0</magicPoints> <prayerPoints>9</prayerPoints> <rangePoints>0</rangePoints> <requiredStats> </requiredStats> <femaleOnly>false</femaleOnly> </ItemWieldableDef> </entry> [/code]
<sprite>256</sprite>
Whenever I use anything over 255 it resets the number and starts loading over, etc 0, 1, 2..., which means it loads the wrong "sprite" for my item.
So my question is how can I raise that limit?

item.title: Max sprite id - items, how to raise?
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

As I said, just change the data-type to short or int… Then you should be able to load many more. A byte is made out of 8 bits, while a short is made out of 16 bits (2 bytes), and an int is made out of 32 bits (4 bytes or 2 shorts).

What I meant with sprite, I of course meant the ID as reference to them in the cache. I also believe every ID is just a pointer to a set of sprites, which all is determined by the current direction your character is pointing to.

Read full topic
item.source: Max sprite id - items, how to raise?

item.title: Max sprite id - items, how to raise?
item.dc:creator: @nexes nexes
item.description:
@nexes wrote:

ephemeral:

I guess, switch the data-type to short, int or whatever (on every place where it is handled). Currently it is using byte as data-type. A byte can only contain a number between 0 and 255, where 0 is the minimum, and 255 is the maximum (I guess you could figure that out yourself? :)).

It’s proparly that, should of thought of that…

ephemeral:

Also, I am not even sure there are that many sprites in the client either? Sprites aren’t the same as items in your inventory. So, if this is the case, I don’t see this to be needed. Anyhow, if you wish to add more new sprites, without having to change others, and you exceed the limit of 256 sprites, just do as I told above. ^

It’s not really sprites or they inventory items, it’s a sprite id for calling settings from animation.xml for one or multiple items. Settings about what color it is, which model to load, which gender it is to.

Example:

  <AnimationDef>
    <name>partyhat</name>
    <charColour>16755200</charColour>
    <genderModel>0</genderModel>
    <hasA>true</hasA>
    <hasF>false</hasF>
    <number>0</number>
  </AnimationDef>

Let’s say one item is a party hat, to get a new color instead of one of the other already made colors, it will load the settings for “sprite” id 254 (which is the settings for a orange party hat) from animation.xml.

If i add one that has id 256+ it will simply restart and load from the buttom, as if it were loading the “sprite” id like this: id requested - max id value (256 in this case).

So it’s actually loading the settings for a model and not a sprite.

Read full topic
item.source: Max sprite id - items, how to raise?

item.description:
@system wrote:

I guess, switch the data-type to short, int or whatever (on every place where it is handled). Currently it is using byte as data-type. A byte can only contain a number between 0 and 255, where 0 is the minimum, and 255 is the maximum (I guess you could figure that out yourself? :)).

Also, I am not even sure there are that many sprites in the client either? Sprites aren’t the same as items in your inventory. So, if this is the case, I don’t see this to be needed. Anyhow, if you wish to add more new sprites, without having to change others, and you exceed the limit of 256 sprites, just do as I told above. ^

item.title: Max sprite id - items, how to raise?
item.dc:creator: @nexes nexes
item.description:
@nexes wrote:

Okay first of all the source is a RSCD v25.

I was playing around with “custom items” and their color, it worked until I got to 256 and over.

Example, from my ItemWieldableDef.xml

	<entry>
		<int>1331</int>
		<ItemWieldableDef>
			<sprite>256</sprite>
			<type>8216</type>
			<wieldPos>4</wieldPos>
			<armourPoints>24</armourPoints>
			<weaponAimPoints>150</weaponAimPoints>
			<weaponPowerPoints>71</weaponPowerPoints>
			<magicPoints>0</magicPoints>
			<prayerPoints>9</prayerPoints>
			<rangePoints>0</rangePoints>
			<requiredStats>
			</requiredStats>
			<femaleOnly>false</femaleOnly>
		</ItemWieldableDef>
	</entry>

256

Whenever I use anything over 255 it resets the number and starts loading over, etc 0, 1, 2…, which means it loads the wrong “sprite” for my item.

So my question is how can I raise that limit?

Read full topic
